page.title: 06Agricultural Camp
page.content: On the road to March you can see Friday Bridge Agricultural Camp. From May to October many people come to stay at the camp to find work on the land. The camp was built by Italian prisoners during the second world war. There were also German prisoners in the camp. there are 36 huts. In 1949 it was bought by the Ministry of Agriculture who ran it as a lend a hand in the land camp. In 1955 it was sold to a group of farmers. Apart from the British, people from Ireland, France, Spain, Portugal, Germany, Holland, Norway, Sweden, Denmark, Italy, Morocco, Algeria, Egypt, Turkey, India, Malaysia, Japan and USA have been known to come to the camp. Some of the campers are taken to work by lorries, vans and cars to nearby farms and farms in other villages.
